metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git GitHub Edit Code
Change Platform:
Edit Code in GitHub
GitHub lets you edit files directly in your browser.
content.html: GitHub lets you edit files directly in your browser.

content.text: This is useful for making quick changes without needing to use Git on your computer.
content.html: This is useful for making quick changes without needing to use Git on your computer.

content.text: Edit Any File
To edit a file (like README.md ), click the file name in your repository, then click the Edit button (pencil icon):
content.html: To edit a file (like README.md), click the file name in your repository, then click the Edit button (pencil icon):

content.text: You can now make changes to the file in the editor. You can edit any file, not just README.md.
content.html: You can now make changes to the file in the editor. You can edit any file, not just README.md.

content.text: Write a Commit Message
After editing, scroll down to the Commit changes section.
content.html: After editing, scroll down to the Commit changes section.

content.text: Add a short, clear description of what you changed in the Commit message box.
content.html: Add a short, clear description of what you changed in the Commit message box.

content.text: This helps others understand your update. Learn more about commits
content.html: This helps others understand your update. Learn more about commits

content.text: Preview Changes
Before saving, you can click Preview changes to see what will change in the file.
content.html: Before saving, you can click Preview changes to see what will change in the file.

content.text: This helps you check your edits before committing.
content.html: This helps you check your edits before committing.

content.text: Commit to a Branch
By default, you can commit directly to the main (or master ) branch.
content.html: By default, you can commit directly to the main (or master) branch.

content.text: For bigger changes, it's best to create a new branch.
content.html: For bigger changes, it's best to create a new branch.

content.text: Select Create a new branch for this commit and start a pull request to work safely. Learn more about branches
content.html: Select Create a new branch for this commit and start a pull request to work safely. Learn more about branches

content.text: Create a New Branch from the Editor
When you choose to create a new branch, GitHub will automatically suggest a branch name.
content.html: When you choose to create a new branch, GitHub will automatically suggest a branch name.

content.text: After committing, you can open a pull request to propose your changes. Learn more about pull requests
content.html: After committing, you can open a pull request to propose your changes. Learn more about pull requests

content.text: That is how you edit code directly in GitHub!
content.html: That is how you edit code directly in GitHub!
